text: We had a lovely time overall in the hotel. The staff were very friendly and kind. The entertainment At night was not very good. The rooms were not cleaned to a high standard and one bottle of water in the room was not sufficient. Normally we would receive fresh water each day in our rooms. Over all the stay was a very pleasant one. Again I have to say the staff were really nice. Especially in the Al bar

Excellent stay at this lovely hotel with its relaxed atmosphere.The staff were very professional yet helpful, friendly and welcoming. Superb buffet breakfast with an opportunity to enjoy the views outside. I had a spacious bedroom with a large bathroom, balcony and views towards the pool and sea. The hotel is well situated within a short walk of amenities in Carvoeiro and a beautiful boardwalk along the cliffs.I would highly recommend Tivoli Carvoeiro and hope to return.

Spent one great week at this hotel. The location allows for great views of the city while maintaining a quite and relaxing atmosphere.This is a small hotel, allowing for excellent service and attention to detail.The room was very nice, large and comfortable. The rest of the facilities were just great with the salt water pool located at the front of the hotel, allowing for a spectacular view while relaxing.Great location, great service and very good facilities.
This place gets better and better the longer you stay as there is so much to do. The staff work hard to ensure everyone is looked after and enjoying their trip. Would highly recommend.

Had a brilliant time. Staff & animation team are excellent and very attentive. Place is immaculate, rooms cleaned everyday. Food good for AI but we went out for dinners in evening. Nothing outside the hotel for kids and a trek for the beach. Stay close if you've got a buggy. Paths are poor around the place and in the oldtown.

We stayed in May 2024, quiet and peaceful place, brand new apartment and leisure area too!! We loved everything! And we will come back when possible, great for family and to rest, the bar is also wonderful !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

What a nice hotel! The views from the top floor were amazing.  The staff upon checking in was helpful. The pools were wonderful.  We had dinner on the back patio and watched the sunset. The food was delicious and the view fantastic. Breakfast was outstanding.  We would stay here again!

Just come back from a Madeira break. This hotel was a little far out from the main places there but that really works to enhance its appeal. The hotel is as close to the beach as you could ever want and is beautifully set into the bay. The rooms are fab and along with a top notch bed (always my priority) were clean, well appointed and spacious. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the food (we were there on a half board basis) was great. All in all I am puzzled. We have stayed in several 5 star rated hotels not this good so why is this hotel rated 4 stars?? It's seclusion was never a problem as road networks are good but I loved the peace it brought. Thanks to all there for helping making this a holiday to remember for all the right reasons.

Me and my partner stayed here at the end of May/start of August (aged 24 and 26)This hotel is absolutely stunning and spotless! Rooms were perfect, staff were so friendly and helpful. I particularly loved the pool area (apart from pool bar closing at random times each day). We stayed for 1 week all inclusive. I would stay here again but definitely NOT all inclusive, but on a self catering basis. The only let down for us was the food. I usually ignore bad reviews on food as im not a fussy eater but the food was terrible. There was a ridiculously small amount of food to choose from and to be honest what they did have out usually could not be put together as a meal. Also the standard of the food was terrible for a 5star hotel. I have stayed in a 3 star hotel with much better quality of food. If it was not for this I would have given this hotel a 5.

A really great hostel, super clean, fancy and with nice vibes. staff are friendly, helpful, and the pub crawl was top.  it was realxed when I was there, albeit in the low season, but still a nice crowd, and the hangout area is a great place to relax and meet people.  Fully stocked kitchen, nice rooms. Lot's of activities which I didn't partake in, but might be nice for others.  clean and clean mainly.  awesome location - cannot complain about that!   Curtains on the beds might be a nice addition.

Lovely hotel in a great location.  Excellent breakfast with very helpful staff.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Lisbon.  The surrounding area is easily walkable with lots of shops and restaurants to pick from.  Would go back.

We visited during Easter. We were 5 staying in a 2 Bedroom apartment. It was road facing just across the reception. Everything in the apartment was neat and lovely. We had asked for a hamper that was provided. The reception staff was courteous and very helpful. They helped us choose local tours and gave whatever information we needed. There was nothing negative about the apartment except the sofa bed which folded on itself when lying down. Happened during sleep so it was a pain trying to correct it. The restaurants in the resort were ok foodwise and price wise. The village was a brief walk away. However it was a slope so one had to climb up. Manageable unless mobility is restricted. The place overall is beautiful and quiet and far better than the  other bustling towns of Algarve.

We very much enjoyed our stay in this charming place. The owner was more than helpful, obliging and friendly. The rooms were very clean and individually decorated and the breakfast (in the garden) was excellent. i would say a car is necessary as the property is not in the centre of the town. Definitely worth a visit.

date: M. Renee McInniswrote a review Oct 2019
text: The Hotel has a wonderful front desk staff. Very helpful and a wonderful welcome drink. Great breakfast and nice restaurant on site. Walking distant to many sites and across the street from a very famous seafood restaurant. Reservations are not taken so be early or prepare for a long wait.

Great location. We received many emails prior to our trip that helped us plan our vacation. I highly recommend the airport transfer, after you get your luggage the driver is waiting there with your name and within 30 min you are at the apartment and Rui was waiting for us.   Rui arranged restaurant reservations and booked our tours that were just perfect. The Douro valley tour was the highlight. The owners genuinely care about Porto and give you lots of information.  With the WhatsApp they are never far away to help in any way.  We had the 2 bedroom apartment that was spacious, clean and beautiful.  The bathroom is gorgeous.  We loved the proximity to the river and enjoyed drinks by the water at night.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: The physical property has a strange layout of narrow hallways and tiny common areas on different levels. Room furniture was not functional and cheap looking with limited closet space. While personnel was very friendly, food service was chaotic and slow. Not the typical Relais and Chateaux quality. Location was excellent though. They

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: Upon check in we learned that they upgraded us to a jr suite   The room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable   The staff was outstanding     They were extremely helpful and knowledgeable and really gave you the feeling that they truly wanted to help to make your vacation the best it could be    The breakfast buffet was good and everything tasted very fresh    The outdoor dining area was gorgeous!  I would definitely stay here again if I return to Lisbon

Do not repeat do not go all inclusive. Rooms super. Food. Not good. Cold cold cold. Drink is local rubbish. I have never complained in my life about hotels in all my 40 years of holidays. But feel I have to warn you. We are still here and can't wait to go home. Rooms are brilliant. Full kitchens with washer and dish washer.english TV. Shame about the food.staff brilliant. Again shame the food is inedible when cold

The rooms are clean, large and comfortable.The staff is very friendly and helpful and services are very good.Breakfast is acceptable and the food in Hotel’s Citrus restaurant is good.The Hotel is Located between the airport and downtown, so you need to take a metro or taxi to go to downtown, but it is not a long distance and not so expensive.Recommended if You like to have a quiet and comfortable stay in Lisbon.

Excellent service and the king size bed was a sure winner! Soft, clean and just what we needed after a long train trip. Room service was good, bit on the expensive side but the food was excellent!This is an excellent hotel for business people or guests only staying for one night. Not great for sightseeing as you are not within walking distance to the old part of Lisbon which is where you will find the major historical sights. You would have to cross big roads to get to public transport. Unless you use taxi's. Also close to Entre compos train station if you are arriving via train.Defiantly use this chain of Hotels again.

A lovely hotel with really nice rooms and brilliant staff.. had a fabulous stay here for 3 nights.  Did not try any of the restaurants however the bar was amazing.  Watched Rugby in their comfortable lounge with drinks brought to us by ever smiling bar staff... thank you for making our stay so fab..!!

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: This is a small boutique hotel with an ideal location.The room we had, 305, was spacious, well laid out and clean on arrival & kept like that.The staff, all young, were just so helpful, nothing being too much trouble. They booked tours & restaurants for us - all were excellent recommendations.

The B&B is fabulous.  The hill-top walled village is fabulous.  The restaurants and quaint shops are fabulous.  If you are driving through beautiful, rural eastern Portugal, this is a must stop.  The Casa Pinto is small but totally charming.  It was the most unique accommodation of our three weeks in Portugal.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The views of the town and the surrounding countryside from the B&B or one of the lovely restaurants is spectacular.  Casa Pinto and Monsaraz are must visits.  (After 6:00 P.M. you can park in the town).

This hotel is beautifully located, in the ´marismas´ (totally undeveloped salt marshes, filled with birds) opposite Tavira island - while it feels quite far from Tavira town itself, as you follow a windy road around salt flats to get there, it´s right by the little dock where you catch the boat to Tavira island.We stayed in a room without a view (a little terrace looking onto the car park), which was fine - reasonable size, even with the travel cot provided and assembled by the hotel (no extra charge). Good food - decent buffet (fresh crab and chocolate fondue, not together obviously) and lots of fresh fruit too. Nice terrace overlooking the pool. Charmless bar with fairly uncringeworthy music, unavoidable as loudspeakered into the dining room, and a rather fine strawberry daiquiri. Kids´ playground and lovely sea walks with a decent beach nearby, with little rivulets, perfect for crab hunting and general kiddy pottering.Only real complaint was that they charged us to use the indoor pool - outrageous - 7.50 euros each, plus swimming hat on top of that. Reception staff were totally unapologetic and rude about this, though pool staff were delightful. I thought that charging to use a hotel facility was very very cheeky, in a four-star hotel. The (free) outdoor pool is lovely for those visiting in warmer weather.

I needed a good room for a week of conference attendance. The hotel asked me either to pay in advance (no refund policy) or to pay a higher rate. I paid in advance. During check in, I still had to produce my credit carda and sign legal documents giving Marriot access rights to my account. No hotel should ask for pre payment AND security. It gives your customers the feeling that you rate them as bums. -- For guests with cars, the location is great, because the next motorway is around the corner. For guests who wish to enjoy their balcony or the pool, sound protectors are advised. Also, if you don't fancy very long walks in the summer heat, you need to pay for many taxi rides (fares are cheap, compared with London or Paris). -- In my room, the WiFi didn't work, even despite lengthy conversations with service persons. The hotel policy of making guests pay extra for (a) ordinary internet use and (b) highspeed uses results in a highly dysfunctional WiFi.

We have been there for one week in Seütember 09. Although the wether was  mixed as expected on the madeiran Northcost we did a lot of beautiful trips and walks  on and out of the Santana region. What really highlitens the stay was the perfect madeiran cuisine in the restaurant. We had espada with fried bananas, espetadas com louro    , tomato soup in the bread containment and a lot more. The view from the restaurant is really overwhelming,  the wine card bears some rellay good and very tasteful local wines like Roca brancha or Seixal , even the Poncha is really perfect. I really would like to recommend this Qinta da Furao for a pleasant stay.

We stay there for the first time is Lisbon. Friendly and warm reception, the hotel is very good located, just a short walk to a beautiful park (Parque Eduardo VII). Is possible park your car for a daily fee. The hotel has modern and clean rooms, service was good in general, we enjoy the breakfast. Completely recommended!

They took my belongings after 1 night when I went out to run some errands, even though I had booked for 2 nights. The personnel seemed utterly incompetent and provided no compensation. I do not recommend this place!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Good traditional after noon tea on the terrace at Reid’s, it doesn’t get much better. Great attention to detail, fine selection of teas and sandwiches. Never tried the vegan options, but I’m sure they would have been just as lovely.Well done Reid’s.

I visit here every 2 years and was impressed this year with the obvious redecoration that has been going on.  Mind you - restaining the decking and waiting for at least 4 days for it to dry was a bit OTT.  We were going to eat in the hotel this time around but the Madeira buffet seems to have disappeared so we went out.  As stated before drinks prices are way too expensive and we go up to the Number Two Pub up the hill.  We also tried lunch at the pool bar - not a good idea - service was very slow and my beefburger had gristle in it.  But everything else was lovely and the staff as always very helpful especially the lovely sun lounger and umbrella man and the gorgeous Bulgaria hawk.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We had planned to visit Reid's for afternoon tea by pre-booking to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary.The Hotel is very grand and kept very well.Unfortunately for our visit the terrace was closed due to work being undertaken and we were shown to a very nice table in the William Room by the most polite staff.  It was a good deal warmer than sitting on the terrace as we were behind glass windows, but still with a lovely view of Funchal Bay.We cannot recommend the service highly enough, particularly as we were offered a complementary glass of bubbly due to the inconvenience- you could hear works noise being carried out nearby.The selection of sandwiches was lovely and the staff kept them coming according to our preference of filling.  The Scones are to die for - still warm and soft inside with lovely local jam and clotted cream.  The individual cakes were plentiful and of a very high patisserie standard.A good  selection of teas served in Wedgewood china service - nothing was too much for the staff to replenish either food or drink.We didn't realise actually how much we had eaten that afternoon until we stood up to leave we were very very full!We would really have liked a stroll in the hotel gardens, as they looked magnificent and just right to walk off the food.  However, these were only for residents use.A fantastic experience overall despite the inconvenience - well recommended and worthy of the cost for the standard of service, food and general experience.

We stayed at the Royal Savoy for 1 week, it was lovely and relaxing,  it is in a good position, within walking distance of funchal town centre and only €5 in a taxi to forum shops.  The rooms were of a good size and all faced the sea!  The hotel bar was rather expensive but other than that not a single complaint.

We went for lunch at the poolside restaurant. I am gluten free and my son is dairy free and the staff were very knowledgeable about allergens and said for us to tell them what we wanted and they could make it gluten free. Staff were very helpful and polite and we will definitely return here.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: A fully inclusive bed; dinner and breakfast 2 week stay - very relaxing - easy to recommend.  Close to Funchal - a 15 minute walk to centre and harbour - easy journey from airport.The staff were attentive and responsive  - and the room and facilities well maintained.  Breakfast was taken by the pool area (choice of both indoors and outdoors)  and always a good selection - with main offerings purposely cooked so very fresh and appetising.  The dinners were taken in a selection of the 4 restaurants - the 2 speciality restaurants were great - as was the seaside terrace - but the bar terrace menu was a tad “same every night”Both pool swimming and sea swimming was available - the sea is accessed via a short ladder and vey deep water but a nice swim to the sea raft - and fully lifeguard attended.Loungers galore - never a problem finding a pair in full sun or shade.Easy to recommend - would return

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: This is excellent 5* hotel, with wonderful gardens, swimming pools and sea. Breakfast has variety of products and all is tasty and fresh. We had room with astonish view. Stuff is very friendly and helpfully.Room decoration, accessories and furniture are old (but well maintain) At the beginning, we had very unconformable hammock-like mattress, but following our request they change the mattress to new one. The room was a bit small.

We stayed 1 night in this horal. Everything is quite new, and delivered a little above expectation. Room, bed, pillow, bed linen and towels great.We booked with breakfast included, which although bureaucratic, was great.Great location for those who want to meet Evora on foot.Don't be late for breakfast or you'll be in line and it may take a while to sit down.I recommend and would return.

The hotel is beautiful and really calm, even when it's fully booked. You can relax and enjoy all the facilities of the hotel. We took the premium experience to have acces to all the facilities and it didn't dissapoint us. Great experience!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Pros: great drinks at the bar, wonderful swimming pools, fabulous breakfast by the pool overlooking the sea and lots of period features all around the hotel. The concierge was helpful in booking activities.Cons: the “classic” rooms which are the most basic are far too small and awkward - to pass between one side of the room to another, we had to squeeze between a desk and a corner of the bed, so perhaps a a foot in width. At the prices for the rooms which are themselves a bit dated if clean, they should be better laid out. Also, we wanted to try the Michelin restaurant in the hotel but bafflingly it is only open on Wednesdays, so anyone staying for a weekend like us has no chance.

Our first family holiday with our 15 month old baby boy. The hotel couldn't have been better, absolutely spotless, the most attentive staff who looked after us all so well. Especially Jose in the Seafront restaurant who made our dinners an absolute joy.The pools, spa and food were the best we have ever experienced. We will definitely be back next year! Thanks to all the staff for making it such a memorable holiday.

This is the third year running we have visited Portugal but first year staying at the Crowne Plaza and we are already planning to return to it next year. Firstly, the location itself is absolutely excellent. A two minute walk to the beautiful Vilamoura beach which was what brought us to this hotel in the first place. Secondly, the hotel is absolutely beautiful! The rooms are top notch, staff are very friendly and accommodating.. there really is nothing negative I can say. Kids area is great - enclosed so you do feel safe letting them have a run around. Restaurant for any meal of the day is brilliant, the breakfast especially.Thank you for making our stay so comfortable, we were very sad to leave!

Wonderful and relaxing hotel located right next to the river and historic centre. Loads of character with the period features and trams trundling past in the streets. Calm and peaceful atmosphere with great breakfast options and afternoon tea and homemade cake! Super helpful and friendly staff - a special shout out to Carla for sharing her local knowledge and annotating our map and to Luis for looking after us so well! Thank you to all!

From the moment we got inside the staff was super helpful and friendly. The rooms were amazing (thank you for the chocolates, they were delicious) views from the rooms were stunning.We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the outdoor pool.We’ve stayed at a few really nice hotels around the island but this one in Santana takes the cake it was amazing!!

My Wife and Me we Stay in Hotel February 16--23 temperature 17C we have wonderful time dream viev excellent service the best is rent a car from Hotel € 28 /day and explore the Island SAO MIGUEL makes sure you havea great camera the best coffee excellent vino € 4 great Portugal Vino fish and beef pork cheese the best you can get Highly recommend make sure you have rain Jacket

We stayed for a week arriving New Years Eve having stayed years ago when it was The Atlantis Hotel and again in 2010 when it had just been refurbished as the Crown PlazaI booked a superior room and requested a higher floor but on arrival I noticed we were only on the 3rd floor. I asked for a higher room to be told we had been upgraded to a deluxe room. I should have pushed harder as the superior and deluxe rooms are no different except superior overlook Quarteira and deluxe Vilamoura - Note unless you are keen to be on the Vilamoura side do not pay the extra that the room rate charges for Deluxe - From our room we overlooked the casino car park and buildings - I can see that from the upper floor you maybe able to see the marina.Staff were very friendly and always welcomed with a greeting and a smile. We had breakfast included and it was super with a very wide range from cooked to continental fruit pastrys etc.Room was comfortable with a very large bed and great bathroom. The room does not have a kettle only an nexpresso machine and they charge €2 for additional capsules - We took box of 10 from our supermarket with us costing only £2.50Another gripe is that they have a spa and whilst they charge for treatments they also charge €11 per day for use of the indoor pool. This in my mind is unacceptable for a so called 5 star hotel particularly in the close season when the outdoor pool is not usable.Would I stay again - Yes but only if I could get a good rate.

Wow wow and wow,This hotel is just beautiful and near lots of bars and restaurants, room spotlessly clean, great pool, and what can I say about the staff everyone that we met just went above and beyond, thee nicest people ever, all I can say is thank you so much we loved our time with you and I am already planning my next visit

Just got back from a group trip to Villa Gale Tavira. Firstly, Tavira town has bags of character and charm. Cobbled streets, squares and gardens with lots of very reasonably priced cafes. Free wi-fi across the town centre - altogether a really lovely little town. The hotel is a very short walk from the town centre - but if you want the beach - that's another story as it's a bit of a journey to get there. ( Though well worth it - its a lovely stretch of sand). The hotel itself is good - well run and similar to other hotels in the chain. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Wi fi is free in the lobby and bar but chargeable if you want it in your room. Safe keys for your room are also charged for. The indoor pool and spa were very nice and well used. The food is a bit of a let-down - who wants to see 'stewed chicken' on a menu ? The buffet does tend to be chicken /fish/ pork every night and it 's a bit indifferent although there is plenty of fresh salad and fruit if you are happy with that. Altogether a good hotel.

My husband, 7 year old kid and I were there the last week of October. We checked into a deluxe double bedroom apartment.That first morning when we arrived into the room, we found the hotel grounds, swimming pools and our room balcony view absolutely stunning! The apartment was clean, kitchen well stocked, bed comfortable, all in all an excellent experience. The breakfast had a large choice, I especially liked the variety of freshly cooked hot food. The beach right in front of the hotel is a long stretch with sandy beaches, plenty of restaurants and other shops to keep busy. The entertainment provided in the evenings in the hotel was also excellent! A delightful experience, no problems faced, we are absolutely returning to this hotel!

This was our first holiday with our 9 month old son and we could't have wished for anything better. The Quinta is a delightful place with wonderful hosts, Jill and Julio. We had a truly memorable stay and met some lovely people. The gardens were a picture with beautiful flowers everywhere, the food was wonderful and the atmosphere was one of total relaxation, home from home.

My husband and I stayed at the Vila Gale Tavira in May this year and I must admit I am surprised by the reviews I have read recently.  The hotel is clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, the buffet breakfast had something for everyone, the room we had was on the ground floor and was fairly spacious and quiet,The hotel is well appointed for everything in Tavira.  Tavira itself is a working town not just a holiday resort, therefore if you are looking for all the usual English pubs, clubs etc., you won't find them here.  Having stayed in other parts of the Algarve we preferred Tavira because it was more Portuguese than other built up areas.With regard to restaurants we felt spoilt for choice.  We would advise a visit to the Bar Romba at lunch time.  You have to be quick as it fills up fast with local business people.  The fish dishes are wonderful and exceptionally well priced.  We would also advise trying the Joao Belhi, Beira Rio and the Brisa do Rio all were excellent particularly the fish dishes.  We would advise you to avoid the Chinese restaurant and the restaurants along the river (at the ferry point) offering discounts.Regarding things to do in Tavira - a visit to the obseratory is well worthwhile and the trip to Tavira Island is well worth it.  We walked the mile or so from the Vila Gale to the ferry point but public transport is also available.  The beach is really spectacular.  We also took the train from Tavira to Monte Gordo which was also well worth the trip.All in all we had an excellent week in a reasonable hotel.

Location is great right on the beach. We were early for booking in and expected to have to wait but the reception staff, who are really friendly and helpful made a few phone calls and booked us in straightaway and a young man carried our luggage and showed us to our apartment. We booked a deluxe one bedroom apartment and we were really pleased with the accomodation which had everything we needed. The cleanliness of the hotel swimming pools and grounds are a credit to the hotel. The maid who cleaned our room was really nice and came almost every other day. The towels were changed regularly and were of a good quality as were the bed sheets which the maid changed and all were really nice and clean. We also had a great balcony and view. There are restaurants and bars close by. The bus stop is just on the main road right outside the hotel and only costs 1 euro 40 cents. We used to walk along the main road and down past the Monica Isabela hotel down to the beach and walk into Albufeira. There are two good supermarkets close by, Inter Marche a five minute walk away and an Aldi about ten minutes walk away. We have only been home about two weeks but we have booked our next holiday here.

We read some of the other reviews, so it seemed like a good choice. It certainly  was. The sisters' were charming and so interesting. The breakfast was excellent.We were only sorry that we were staying for one night before moving south.Within a five minute walk, there were a choice of restaurants, with suckling pig being the speciality of the area.We would certainly stay there again.

My husband and I visted this hotel last july. On arrival we were greeted by Mr Diaz junior.  His first question was if we had breakfast and since we didn't have any we could have some in the breakfast room eventhough breakfast was over. We could have anything we wanted. He promised us that our room would be ready within an hour. And indeed he kept his promise. The rooms are clean and big enough.The staff is very friendly and will help you with anything you need.Breakfast is simple but delisious. Restaurants are 2 minutes walking and good.The swimming pool was wonderfull and there where some days I had it just to myself.Mr Diaz senoir took us in his own car into the hills to buy a typical maderia souvenier. He just offered us to take us there and on our way back he took us sight seeing to some beautifull spots near Funchal.This hotel is located away from the hotel zone and it is a nice and quiet surronding... no carsTo any one who likes peace and quiet and good service this is the place to be... we will be back to this hotel soon
An absolutely amazing experience.  Very relaxed, wonderful food, lovely staff. Luxury with a casual atmosphere.  We can’t wait to return.

hotel_name: Porto PalÃ¡cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Gorgeous place where spending time and relaxing. Awesome panoramic from the top roof over Porto and surrounding views while dinner time.Comfortable and wide rooms where the guest will be able to rest.

The hotel is just outside of the old town (about a five minute walk) and is large and modern. We stayed for one night in a junior suite which was huge. Friendly staff and s nice pool (although cold!). Underground parking.

The best part of staying at this aparthotel is that the rooms are unusually large for Europe. We were in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom unit. There was a full size fold out couch in the living room, which was  opened and made up when we checked in. There is a dining table and service for 5. The kitchenette was \bare bones\"
year: microwave and 2 burners. The pool and surrounding area were clean and well-kept. There is a small restaurant
extracted_date_str: but we did not eat there.It appears at first blush that the hotel is very far off the beaten path. But actually being on a side street means that it is pretty quiet at night. You can catch the train just about a block away--walk UP the hill to the station rather than down. It's much closer. You can catch the hop on-hop off bus Marquis de Pombal plaza which is a short walk away.There's a small grocery store across the main road. It's perfect to stock the kitchen for breakfast and snacks. Make a left out of the hotel
extracted_date: and then a left and go half a block to a tiny restaurant (mid-block) which has terrific food at really reasonable prices.There is a McDonald's right across from the hotel.The staff at the front desk was a \"mixed bag.\" Some quite willing to make conversation and assist with plans and suggestions
sentiment_score: this was an excellent stay at a reasonable

hotel_name: Quinta do Morgado - Monte da Eira Apartments
text: The room was very clean and the cleaning ladies very helpful and nice, they make a very sweet bed for my baby boy.You have to ask for a room wiht air conditionning, not all room have it.The restaurant \a Nora Velha\" is GREAT
month: very nice personel and the food is very very good and not too expansive.The pool is great but can be a little bit small when the apartments are all rented.Great vacations."

text: I stayed here for 3 night in June with a friend. The hotel is located on the river tagus a 7 Euro trip from the city centre. The location is excellent, Belem is a very nice part of Lisbon. The open top tour bus stops just outside and is convenient for hopping on and getting an overview of the main sites. The pool area is very cool and hip, the rooms are big (we stayed in a superior with balcony) beds are very comfortable. The bar area is very funky with great cocktails perfect for a starter drink.We ate in the hotel on the 1st night the food was excellent with a gorgeous selection of wine all well priced. I would highly recommend this hotel for a base in lisbon.

hotel_name: Quinta do Morgado - Monte da Eira Apartments
text: We stayed for the one night prior to checking into a villa in Altura. We received a very warm welcome and they accommodated an earlier check in time. They provided a very helpful map of the local area and directions to locate the apartment. The accommodation was on the second floor where we enjoyed a two bedroom/two bathroom apartment. The air conditioning worked perfectly and it was spotlessly clean. Access to the second floor for anyone with mobility needs may be difficult as there were a lot of stairs. Large balcony overlooking the pool. No designated parking but plenty on the road below the apartment block. It was quiet and felt very safe. Tennis court and pool very close by as well as a restaurant and bar. WiFi is chargeable and not particularly cheap but it worked well at a good speed. Excellent, helpful and accommodating staff, easy to find, very clean and well equipped accommodation and very close to beautiful Tavira town centre. Good access to the airport as well. Would certainly use again.

Gorgeous views, fabulous rooms, perfect service from serene, welcoming staff,great location--what more can you ask for from a hotel?  We arrived drooping from an overseas flight and hassling at the airport with lost luggage to an oasis of kindness.  Theresa, the front office  desk manager, took one look at us and had our room prepared immediately even though we had arrived at 10:30am.  While we waited, other front desk staff assured us that they would send our luggage up to our room as soon as it arrived and settled us in comfy chairs overlooking the Tagus River to await our bed.Our huge second floor room overlooked the marina, the Tagus River and the landmark Belem Tower.  Waiting on the table when we arrived were four of the national pastries, Pastais de Belem, which would become an addiction for us during our stay in Portgual.  The room had every amenity you could ask for including charging outlets on the desk for our electronics and genuinely comfortable chair and chaise for reading and planning.After a long nap, we wandered down to Reception and inquired about a simple Portuguese restaurant.  After getting a feel for what we might like, the young man made the reservation for us, called a cab for us and when it arrived, escorted us to the cab telling the driver exactly where to take us.  This is a priceless service to those still reeling from overseas travel!  His recommendation turned out to be one of our favorite restaurants in Lisbon.  There is no need for a separate concierge because every front desk staffer is a knowledgeable, multi-lingual problem-solver.  When we needed to ship an item back home, the first person I asked at the desk immediately found the name of the company they use, called with detailed instructions for picking up my item and then provided me with all the written information I would need to track my shipment.  The company they connected me with was extremely helpful when we ran into a technical glitch and my item made it to the US exactly as promised.  None of this would have been possible without the help of the Altis Belem and, as with every inquiry, everything was effortless.The next morning we made our way down to the lovely breakfast room with tables both indoors and outside for our inclusive breakfast.  We gave our room number to Natalie and from then on we were greeted each morning by her welcoming smile.  She never had to ask our room number again!We had a similar delightful experience in the beautiful bar which again has seating both indoors and outside overlooking the Tagus River. We discovered that the Altis Belem bar had a bottle of the almost-impossible-to-find-in-the-USA Pappy Van Winkle bourbon and thus began an ongoing conversation with Andres.  During quiet moments in the bar, he was extremely generous about sharing information and stories about his country which enormously enhanced our visit.  When we told him where we were headed the next day, he would suggest certain sights not to miss and the best route to take and he was always absolutely right.We had only planned to stay three nights in Lisbon but we extended our stay one night because we just weren't ready to leave this perfect hotel and we returned for two more nights two weeks later in our trip just to make sure we hadn't dreamed how wonderful it was.  It MADE our first trip ever to Portugal.
Nice clean hotel in a good location.Helpful staff on the deskGood breakfast.

The hotel was easy to find on the side of one of Lisbon's great landmarks, the car park was less easy to find but one extra turn around the round about solved the problem.  The staff were very friendly and the lobby bar and lounge were very comfortable.  The lifts were small but surprisingly efficient.  The rooms and bathrooms were good sized clean and comfortable.  Taking the lift to the basement breakfast room was a surprise - instead of a small dark room there was a very large and grand room with natural lighting provide via a garden atrium.  The hotel while appearing to be a little out of the city centre was actually at the top of a grand avenue which runs all the way through the city centre down to the harbour on the river - an easy 20 minutes walk.  If you prefer buses run from across the roundabout and the terminal for all the hop-on-hop-off tourist buses is on an adjacent side of the square.  Our room facing the large square and roundabout had its own spacious balcony with a couple of deck chairs which captured the sun throughout the day.  For our first trip to Lisbon a great choice.

Stayed there on recent visit with my family (including two boys). They have a small \kids room\" with the most amazing and helpful staff that gave us some great insights into things to do with kids.  The hotel is quite modern and the morning breakfast is so well worth it with some of the most spectacular views of the Tagus. It's quite close to the airport (and should cost no more than 10euros - beware of taxis that over charge) so it made making our early morning flight a breeze. It is however
month: a 15minute drive to the center of Lisbon or you can take the metro to get to the center quite easily (will take a bit longer).  This hotel is great for runners
year: as i took long runs along the river and there is a lot to do around the area - a few museums and some nice restaurants but not the authentic colorful Lisbon you get when in the center of the city.  If you want peace and quiet and don't mind trekking to the center
extracted_date_str: this is a beautiful hotel to stay it.  If you want to be in the center of it all and just walk everywhere
extracted_date: I would recommend staying closer to the city center."

hotel_name: ibis Styles Lisboa Centro Liberdade NE
text: I use a lot of Ibis all around Spain Portugal and France and around 60% are brilliant, 30% are pretty good and 10% are just rubbish and shouldn't be called Ibis. This is one of them. Although the staff are very friendly and rooms very clean. Beds very lumpy and uncomfortable and air con not the best. Breakfast experience very dull. So after three days we move to an Ibis (red) a few km's away. What a difference. Great place. Great bed, great breakfast etc. So best to avoid Styles to avoid expensive dissapointment.

Perfect Location, friendly atmosphere, comfortable rooms and the greatest staff.The staff made me feel at home, to see their friendly smile in the morning gives you all the energy needed to start the day.Walking distance to everywhere.Definatly one of the best hostels I ever stayed at!

Pestana Bahia PraiaPraia de Agua d'Alto, Vila Franca do Campo, Sao Miguel 9680-365, Portugal (Formerly Hotel Bahia Palace)5 days stay in the hotel including 3 without baggage lost by TAP airlines was excellent, service very helpfull

Excellent hotel with lovely grounds ,a bit far to walk to town but taxis are frequent and reasonable, would stay again especially for family holiday. Maybe use boutique hotel for grandchild.food was excellent, bar and staff are friendly:

Nice modern hotel. All rooms have a large balcony, ours with a view of the river. The rooms are clean and the bathrooms are well equipped.The buffet dinner is excellent and there is a choice of wines fo follow.The best thing about this hotel is the closeness to the city center, which is within easy walking distance.Only setback is the suroundings with a delapidated Building site. Not so pleasant to look at.The hotel has a very large swimming pool.

Absolutely a wonderful hotel. Everything about this hotel is absolutely amazing even the location is perfect to be close to beach and amenities without being bothered by them. The staff are so attentive and nothing is too much problem for them. The cleanliness is superb everyday our room was given an immaculate clean we had room with terrace on ground floor it was perfect. You notice everything in the hotel is spotless. Good breakfast. Nice bar. Good pool. Parking is secure and underground. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough 5 stars all the way
